title: Shooting incident reported in Borella
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Borella last night (08), police stated.

title: President directs officials to address growing concerns surrounding e-commerce
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has called on officials to address the growing concerns surrounding e-commerce and deliver efficient, fair and customer-centric solutions to the issues currently faced in this area.

title: More than 160 people still missing after deadly Texas floods
byline: There are 161 people still missing in Texas in the aftermath of last weekend’s deadly flash floods, the state’s governor has said.

title: Several spells of showers expected in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (09), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sheikh Hasina authorised deadly Bangladesh crackdown, leaked audio suggests
byline: A deadly crackdown on student-led protests in Bangladesh last year was authorised by then prime minister Sheikh Hasina, according to audio of one of her phone calls reportedly verified by the BBC.

title: Trump says US must send more weapons to Ukraine, days after ordering pause in deliveries
byline: President Donald Trump said Monday the U.S. will have to send more weapons to Ukraine, just days after ordering a pause in critical weapons deliveries to Kyiv.

title: Nishantha Jayaweera takes oath as NPP National List MP
byline: Ushettige Don Nishantha Jayaweera was sworn in as a National People’s Power (NPP) National List Member of Parliament before the Speaker of the House, (Dr.) Jagath Wickramaratne, a short while ago.

title: Fuel distribution crisis?
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Private Bowser Owners’ Association says fuel distribution activities have been arbitrarily handed over to another party.

title: Trump to announce trade deals with 7 nations, prepares more letters amid tariff row
byline: US President Donald Trump has announced he will be releasing fresh letters on Wednesday regarding trade deals and tariff. The US president’s announcement comes a day after he released letters to 14 countries for revised and hiked tariffs.

title: Two suspects arrested in connection with Kandana shooting incident
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in connection with a shooting incident near the Kandana Public Market on July3, where one person succumbed and another injured, police noted.

title: Imposter used AI to pose as US Secretary of State and contact foreign ministers
byline: The US State Department said it is investigating an imposter who used artificial intelligence to impersonate Secretary of State Marco Rubio and contact three foreign ministers.

title: Youth missing after falling into Singimale Reservoir while taking photographs
byline: A youth has been reported missing and is feared drowned after he fell into the Singimale Reservoir in Hatton while taking a selfie, police said.

title: US used car prices surge as tariffs drive market volatility
byline: A gauge of U.S. used vehicle prices sold at wholesale auctions that proved predictive ahead of the inflation surge following the COVID pandemic is climbing again, last month notching its largest annual increase in nearly three years.

title: SC orders UGC to strictly implement existing guidelines to prevent ragging in universities
byline: The Supreme Court today ordered the University Grants Commission to strictly implement the set of guidelines that have already been formulated to prevent ragging in universities.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya granted bail
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and subsequently remanded, has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Shanakiyan calls for international prosecutor’s office to probe Easter attacks
byline: A special prosecutor’s office must be established with international assistance to conduct an inquiry into the 2019 Easter Sunday attacks which left more than 250 dead, Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) Member of Parliament Shanakiyan Rasamanickam said in Parliament today (09).

title: Apple COO Jeff Williams to retire in major changing of guard
byline: Apple Inc. Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams is retiring as the company’s longtime No. 2, marking a major changing of the guard at an already tumultuous time for the iPhone maker.

title: PM Harini promises internet connections for all secondary schools before 2027
byline: By the end of 2026, it is expected that all secondary schools will be provided with internet connections, said Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya in Parliament today (09).

title: France’s Bayeux Tapestry to return to Britain after 900 years
byline: France will lend Britain the Bayeux Tapestry, allowing the 11th century masterpiece to come back across the Channel for the first time in more than 900 years, in a show of friendship to mark President Emmanuel Macron’s state visit.

title: Another 125 Army personnel assume UN Peacekeeping duties in Lebanon
byline: The 16th Contingent of the Sri Lanka Force Protection Company (SLFPC) has officially assumed peacekeeping duties under the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL), the Ministry of Defence said.

title: US scraps shoe removal at airport screening
byline: Passengers at United States airports will no longer have to remove their shoes to pass through security under a new policy unveiled on Tuesday (Jul 8), 20 years after the requirement was introduced.

title: Popular Indian actress Hansika Motwani arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Popular Indian Bollywood and Kollywood actress Hansika Motwani has arrived in Sri Lanka today (09) from Mumbai.

title: Air India jet’s fuel switches in focus, as crash preliminary report nears
byline: A preliminary report into the deadly crash of an Air India jetliner in June is expected to be released by Friday, three sources with knowledge of the matter said, with one adding the probe had narrowed its focus to the movement of the plane’s fuel control switches.

title: Police raise concern after teenage boy in Mahiyanganaya diagnosed with AIDS
byline: A 15-year-old schoolboy from Mahiyanganaya has been confirmed to have contracted Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS), according to Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) of the Badulla Division G.W.B.S. Palipana.

title: Public urged to use drinking water sparingly amid dry weather conditions
byline: Due to the prevailing dry weather conditions, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has requested consumers to use drinking water sparingly.

title: Sri Lanka’s prisons exceed capacity by 20,000: Prisons Spokesman
byline: Although the capacity of prisons across the country is 12,000, approximately 33,000 inmates are being held at present, according to Prisons Media Spokesman Jagath Weerasinghe.

title: More than 100 hurt as efforts to contain Marseille wildfire continue
byline: French firefighters are continuing to battle a wildfire that reached the outer edge of Marseille and has left more than 100 people injured.

title: ‘Pillayan’ had prior knowledge of 2019 Easter attacks: Public Security Minister
byline: Former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias ‘Pillayan’ had prior knowledge about the 2019 Easter Sunday attacks, based on investigations carried out thus far, claimed the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala, in Parliament today (09).

title: Speaker’s official residence to be transformed into knowledge center
byline: The official residence of the Speaker will be transformed into a knowledge center, providing information to members representing all levels of governance in the country, Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne said during a meeting held at Parliament with a delegation from the European Union.

title: European heatwave caused 2,300 deaths, scientists estimate
byline: Around 2,300 people died of heat-related causes across 12 European cities during the severe heatwave that ended last week, according to a rapid scientific analysis published on Wednesday.
